metadata.dc:author: Fernández Jiménez-Ortiz, H
Gómez Marco, J J
Rojo Zamanillo, I
Fernández Fernández, E
metadata.dc:description: Intravesical instillation of bacillus Calmette-Guérin is the elective treatment for transitional cell and in situ bladder carcinoma. Severe complications occur very seldom but must be known and promptly recognized. We present a case of miliary tuberculosis reactivation secondary to the mentioned treatment.
metadata.dc:title: Tuberculosis miliar secundaria a instilación endovesical de BCG.
[Miliary tuberculosis in a patient treated with BCG intravesical instillation].
